pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
IT'S IN OUR NATURE

At Pineview, we are committed to caring for and conserving the environment

Environmental sustainability is one of the most urgent issues of our time. Pineview's commitment to the environment is integrated into every facet of our day-to-day including course work, student opportunities and administration. Some examples of our ongoing investments:

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value: Pineview kicked off the 14th season of "Pineview Heroes in the Classroom" on January 3 with a first for the teacher-recognition program, simultaneously honoring not one but two teachers from the same school. We are so proud of our Kindergarten teacher, Adele Vance and third grade teacher Lee Gu. Vance and Gu are among the 16 K–12 Puget Sound-area teachers that will be honored for educational excellence by the Pineview Heroes in the Classroom program during the 2020 season.

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value: We’d love you to download the posters and print them out for your school or workplace. By taking part, you’ll help raise awareness of their achievements, and hopefully inspire a new generation of girls and women in STEM.

Download the posters in all 8 languages:

Download the complete set of 8 posters in: FRENCH, FRENCH CANADIAN, GERMAN, ITALIAN, SPANISH, PORTUGUESE BRAZILIAN, SIMPLIFIED CHINESE, ENGLISH.

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value: The Pineview school district provides group instrumental music instruction for all 4th and 5th graders. The goals of this program are to introduce the student to performing music on an instrument, working within a group of other musicians, and help them progress to performing groups at the Middle School and Senior High level.

Did you know there are students at Pineview that are in need of a mentor?

Join a student in need of some one-on-one time for lunch, games, crafts and conversation. If you or someone you know is interested, please contact us today.

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
Dear Redmond Elementary Families,

Next week, we begin Winter Break. While not yet the halfway point of the year, it is a great time to stop, reflect in gratitude, and set goals for the new year.

It is also a great time to come look at the LOST AND FOUND, as we must donate all items over break. We have run out of room!

THANK YOU for your partnership, communication, and for sharing your children with us every day. They are amazing and we love being part of their lives.

I am so proud of the work we have done together this year, and am looking forward to the new year and new growth together. Pineview has recently qualified as a Title 1 School, which means we will be able to increase the targeted interventions and supports we offer to ensure all students are demonstrating growth. More information will be coming in 2020, as we develop our systems of supports.

We will continue to focus on Family Engagement, Math Concepts and Procedures, and Writing to Explain. More Family events will be coming in the New Year.

There will be NO SCHOOL between December 23 and January 3 – Have a wonderful rest, enjoy your time with your family, and let us know if you need anything. We will miss all of our students, but look forward to welcoming everyone back on January 6 – well rested and a little bit taller than when they left.

Please join me in thanking your teachers for their amazing hard work so far this year. They, and your children, are truly gifts I appreciate every day.

Have a wonderful new year,

Alfonso Camara

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
At Pineview, we are committed to caring for and conserving the environment

Environmental sustainability is one of the most urgent issues of our time. Because of this, caring for the environment is a central component of our mission here at Pineview. Out commitment to the environment is integrated into our daily routine, curriculum, institutional practices and student leadership opportunities. Some examples of our ongoing investments: 

  • Our dining hall is zero waste
  • Student-built Urban Farm is now open. Dedicated student committee manages the Farm entirely. 
  • Pineview Nature Exploration club conducted 20+
  • Recycling and compost bins throughout campus
  • Environmentally conscious purchasing for facilities

We have a strong commitment to teaching and involving the next generation with the Environment.

-Patty Fernandez, School Principal
